news.title: As pressure mounts, China Evergrande seeks delaying onshore bond payment
news.para: Evergrande is struggling to repay more than $300 billion in liabilities, including nearly $20 billion of offshore bonds deemed in cross-default by ratings agencies last month after it missed payments.

news.title: Bombay HC restrains Orbit Ventures from creating third-party rights on properties
news.para: In September 2017, Axis Finance Ltd. lent Rs 130 crores to Orbit Ventures Developers. As against the funds disbursed by Axis Finance, the securities, including 12 unsold flats in a project in Mumbai’s Andheri suburb and receivables in respect of 54 identified flats, were created in favour of the lender.

news.title: Lodha to repay $225 million bonds in next four months ahead of March-2023 maturity
news.para: Lodha had raised these $225 million bonds in March 2020 against the UK projects. In its India operations, the company has provided a guidance of reducing its debt to below Rs 6,000 crore by March 2023.

news.title: Gurugram: Seven townships get DTCP nod to install gates
news.para: The DTCP, in its order, said that to provide a sense of security to the residents without hampering inter-colony and intra-colony movement, the gates will be allowed on the condition that security guards man the gates or boom barriers, 24x7.

news.title: Ulhasnagar to get unique development plan to curb illegal buildings: Lok Sabha MP
news.para: According to Dr Shinde, the problem of Ulhasnagar is completely different than any other city in the state hence, the cluster plan cannot be implemented. Several meetings of ministers and the concerned officials have taken place in Mantralaya about the new development plan.

news.title: Aurangabad civic body starts control room for removal of construction waste
news.para: The building inspectors and sanitation staff of the local civic body have also been asked to alert the newly set-up control room in case they come across such dumping.

news.title: Greater Noida development body reduces its financial debt by Rs 2,600 crore
news.para: Narendra Bhooshan, CEO GNIDA said, “In the case of industrial investment, the authority has set a new record. For the first time, in the current financial year and with three months still remaining to go, the city has earned Rs 315 crore through industrial investments alone.”

news.title: Nashik civic body unwilling to waive tax on small properties
news.para: The NMC officials said, of the total 5.5 lakh properties in the city, around 2.5 lakh measure less than 500 sq ft. Moreover, around 50% of the total revenue through property tax comes from this segment, which is estimated at around Rs 50 crore.

news.title: Chennai: CMDA to act against 216 owners in Anna Nagar colony for building violations
news.para: This comes two months after CMDA served lock-and-seal notices to unauthorised constructions at the apartment complex. The owners will be given a maximum of ten days to vacate the deviated portions, after which demolition would start, sources said.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Building-use quandary for thousands of families in Bopal-Ghuma
news.para: ​Roughly 80% of the 40,000 property units or dwellings do not have ‘Building Use’ (BU) permissions that fulfill requirements under the Gujarat Town Planning and Urban Development Act.

news.title: Nagpur civic body passes resolution to exempt tax to properties up to 500 sq ft
news.para: The committee headed by Mahendra Dhanvijay said the government has taken a decision to extend the benefit to properties situated in Mumbai a couple of days ago.

news.title: Stamp duty & registration collection rises 62% in Gujarat
news.para: Simultaneously, a 34% jump has been recorded in the number of properties registered between April and December this year, as compared to the same period last year.

news.title: Ensure villager-friendly land-pooling policy under Padma scheme: Haryana deputy CM
news.para: On this occasion, principal secretary, HSIIDC, Vijayendra Kumar, managing director, HSIIDC, Vikas Gupta, director general, MSME, Amneet P Kumar, OSD to deputy chief minister, Kamlesh Bhadu and other senior officers were present.

news.title: Credai-NCR to provide free vaccination to over 5,000 construction workers
news.para: ​CREDAI-NCR, in association with HT Parekh Foundation and HDFC Capital, has launched a free vaccination drive being facilitated by Narayana Superspeciality Hospital for construction workers and their families in Delhi-NCR.

news.title: Nitin Gadkari not happy with steel, cement companies' approach in road construction
news.para: Road Transport and Highways Minister Gadkari said that he is not very happy with the approach of steel and cement companies and stressed that there was a need to encourage new materials like carbon steel and steel fibre.
